subject: Home & DIY
title: How Voice Assistants Actually Work
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Voice Assistants Actually Work usable.

hook.text: When you say 'Hey Alexa,' the device wakes but doesn't understand you yet. Your voice goes to a server for thinking.

buildup.text: The wake word is caught locally by a tiny on-device model. Everything after it streams to cloud servers.

discovery.text: Cloud ASR converts speech to text, NLP extracts intent, a response is synthesized and sent back‚Äîall in milliseconds.

twist.text: The round trip takes 200-800ms. Edge AI pushes more processing onto the device to cut latency and boost privacy.

climax.text: Next-gen assistants with large language models handle context and follow-ups‚Äîshifting from commands to conversation.

punchline.text: Your smart speaker is a microphone with a very smart friend in the cloud.

quiz.question: What part of voice assistant processing happens on the device itself?
